capsules_submitted.utterance: Hagrid's gender is indeed male. I've always found it interesting how J.K. Rowling chose to make him a half-giant, and his masculinity has been an important aspect of his character throughout the series.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Hagrid, I've always thought he's a great guy, despite being a bit rough around the edges. I mean, who wouldn't want to have a half-giant as a gamekeeper at Hogwarts? He's got a heart of gold, even if he doesn't always show it.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's incredible to think about what he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world just because you're a target for Lord Voldemort? It's almost too much to handle. But despite all the challenges, Harry grew up to be an amazing young man, and his legacy continues to inspire people all over the world.
